results.title: New Jack City
results.creator_credit: Mario Van Peebles, George Jackson, Doug McHenry and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This gangster movie for the 90’s has a hard hitting anti drug message, and an enigmatic villain in Nino Brown (Wesley Snipes), a seemingly untouchable drug baron. Brown is a self made man, an entrepreneurial success - the only problem is, he’s made his money from crack. He also has a curious sense of communal loyalty, sharing his wealth with the community around him (and who love him for this generosity), despite supplying a substance that kills. Hot on his tail are the angels, 2 unconventional police officers Scotty and Nick (Ice-T, Judd Nelson) who will stop at nothing to rid the New York City streets of Nino Brown’s power. Brown has converted an abandoned Harlem apartment building into an impenetrable fortress which houses his gang, the Cash Money Brothers. This building must be infiltrated and the only way to do it is to send someone in undercover. Initially they send an ex drug addict (Chris Rock), but when he is unsuccessful, it’s left to Scotty to play the part of a drug dealer and make his way to Nino Brown himself. Cast also includes Vanessa Williams.

results.title: New Guinea Patrol
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams, Peter Dimond, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Follows the work of a three-month expedition to survey and open up uncontrolled territory in the Papuan highlands.

results.title: Never a Backward Step
results.brief_description: Wryly satirical documentary on Lord Thomson of Fleet who discusses his life in the British press, television and financial fields. The extent and scope of his business interests are dramatically shown.

results.title: National Velvet (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Clarence Brown, Pandro S. Berman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “National Velvet” by Enid Bagnold, this is the incredible story of a girl who rides to victory in the celebrated Grand National at Aintree, England. Velvet Brown, a young girl passionately interested in horses wins a horse in a raffle and with the help of Mi, an ex-jockey, sets out to win the greatest steeplechase in the world, the Grand National. Stars Elizabeth Taylor and Mickey Rooney. Rated: G

results.title: Napoleon
results.brief_description: Acclaimed as the most accurate depiction of the life and times of Napoleon this film depicts the early beginnings, the famed love saga with Josephine, and the undisputable achievements of history’s most colourful conqueror. Filmed on location at the actual historical sites of Versailles, Fountainbleau and the Chateau of Malmaison. The star-studded cast features Orson Welles and Yves Montand.

results.title: Naked killer
results.creator_credit: Clarence Fok Yiu, Jing Wong and Wong Jing's Workshop Ltd
results.brief_description: An amphetamine paced delight, this furiously edited Hong Kong film is about a group of killer female assassins who decide it is time to enact their revenge on the men who have obstructed their lives. The plot is largely preposterous but what is undeniable is the sheer pleasure taken by the film-makers in delivering a never-ending feast of action, spectacle, colour and martial arts fighting. Director Fok-Yiu is one of the talented South East Asian directors who have proven an influence on directors as diverse as Quentin Tarantino and Australia’s Geoffrey Wright. The film features a cold-blooded lesbian killer, Princess, who steals the show in a subversive feminist reworking of the karate “villain”. Though violent, the action is tongue-in-cheek. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: My Brilliant Career
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Margaret Fink and New South Wales Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the novel, “My Brilliant Career” by Miles Franklin, this is the story of Sybella Melvyn, a sensitive, passionate young woman who leaves the countryside in search of an artistic future. She develops a relationship with landowner Harry Beecham, but is faced with making a decision between less-than-perfect love and independence. Starring Judy Davis and Sam Neill.

results.title: Muppet Treasure Island
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Jim Henson Productions, Martin G. Baker and Brian Henson
results.brief_description: The Muppets cast off for the high-seas adventure in this swashbuckling send-up of Robert Louis Stevenson’s immortal tale. Cast features Tim Curry as Long John Silver and the voices of Billy Connolly, Jennifer Saunders, Kevin Bishop, Frank Oz.

results.title: Mrs. Soffel
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Scott Rudin, Edgar J. Scherick and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A woman who distributes Bibles to prison inmates has an affair with one of them and later helps him to escape. Set in Pittsburgh at the turn of the century, starring Diane Keaton and Mel Gibson.

results.title: Mouchette
results.creator_credit: Robert Bresson, Anatole Dauman, Parc Film and Argos Films
results.brief_description: Based on the Georges Bernanos novel “Nouvelle histiore de Mouchette”, Robert Bresson’s unflinching tale of poverty and cruelty is an agonising and unsentimental film experience. Mouchette (Nadine Nortier) is a 14 year old peasant school girl. Her mother is dying and her father is a brutal alcoholic, leaving her to fend for herself and her baby brother amidst a harsh and indifferent community. When local poacher Arsene (Jean-Claude Guilbert) turns to Mouchette for an alibi over a possible murder, the young girl desperately responds to his neediness, unaware that she is being used yet again. Bresson strips scenes, performances and emotions down to their bare necessities, creating a unique style which at first might seem alienating but ultimately depicts the human experience with mystery, grace and poignancy. In French with English subtitles. Cast also includes Maria Cardinal, Paul Herbert, Jean Vimenet (Awards: Best film 1967 Venice Film festival)
